thread.title: Area Roundup 10-10-15: Lucerne Valley football starts league play with win
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 10-10-15: Lucerne Valley football starts league play with win

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 10-10-15: Lucerne Valley football starts league play with win
text: Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 10:28 PM By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 10:28 PM » Social News WILDOMAR — A tight first half gave way to a rout as the Lucerne Valley football team opened its Agape League schedule with an 80-36 win over California Lutheran on Saturday. The Mustangs went into halftime with a 42-30 lead thanks to a late score and wasted no time extending that lead in the third quarter. Lucerne Valley received the second-half kickoff and scored on its first drive. California Lutheran fumbled on the following drive and the Mustangs took over at the C-Hawks’ 40-yard line. Lucerne Valley went on to score to take a commanding lead. California Lutheran scored just once in the second half as Lucerne Valley’s defense cleaned a few things up. “We just tried to keep our guys fired up and reminded them of some of their responsibilities,” said Lucerne Valley head coach Chris Klinger. “They were throwing some wide receiver screens on us and getting big yardage and we played those much better in the second half.” Jacob Carmona and Zack Mejia each found the end zone multiple times for the Mustangs, as did backup running back Jacob Kleber. “We had a lot of guys contribute, good team effort tonight,” said Klinger. Lucerne Valley next hosts Hesperia Christian in what may be the Mustangs’ toughest matchup of the Agape League slate. “We’re going to face a tough team in Hesperia Christian, but I think we’ll match up well against them,” said Klinger. “They’re similar to us, run a similar formation.” That game will begin at 7 p.m. in Lucerne Valley on Oct. 16. PREP FOOTBALL Lutheran/La Verne 28, ACE 23 At La Verne, ACE gave up a late touchdown to fall to Lutheran. The Eagles led by 12 points in the fourth quarter but the Trojans gradually cut into the lead. Lutheran recovered an onside kick late in the fourth quarter and went on to take the lead on that drive. ACE lost both of its starting cornerbacks to injury during the game and Daily Press Athlete of the Week Jacob McLain was also out due to injury. Johan Cougher, Matt Constable and Playah Brah each scored a touchdown for ACE. “They’re all growing together, which I think is going to prove to be huge in a year or two,” said ACE head coach Mike Dickinson. “They’re building together just as much as a family as a football team.” ACE plays its final road game of the season at Crossroads Christian on Oct. 16. By Staff Reports
